page.title: 02A TOUR OF THE VILLAGE 1
page.content: Coming from{TIVERTON}your first sight of{SAMPFORD PEVERELL}is the crossroad at Batten's Cross. You are at the beginning of{Turnpike} which is a long straight hill taking you down towards Sampford Bridge.This bridge takes you over the canal and into Lower Town.A hairpin junction leads you into Chains Road. The road which takes you past the canal,which is a lovely picnic spot leads away to a circular route back to Batten's Cross. As you go along Lower Town road you are passing through what came to be the centre of the village,with shops, inns and a fair twice a year. Today it is mainly houses with a housing estate called Court Way which is on the site of the{ST. BONIFACE {ORPHANAGE}for boys.
